26/**
27 * @fileoverview A Html SAX parser.
28 *
29 * Examples of usage of the {@code goog.string.html.HtmlParser}:
30 * <pre>
31 * var handler = new MyCustomHtmlVisitorHandlerThatExtendsHtmlSaxHandler();
32 * var parser = new goog.string.html.HtmlParser();
33 * parser.parse(handler, '<html><a href="google.com">link found!</a></html>');
34 * </pre>
35 *
36 * TODO(user, msamuel): validate sanitizer regex against the HTML5 grammar at
37 * http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/syntax.html
38 * http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/parsing.html
39 * http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/tokenization.html
40 * http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/tree-construction.html
41 *
42 * @supported IE6, IE7, IE8, FF1.5, FF2, FF3, Chrome 3.0, Safari and Opera 10.
43 */
44
45goog.provide('goog.string.html');
46goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlParser');
47goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags');
48goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Elements');
49goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Entities');
50goog.provide('goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler');
51
52
53
54/**
55 * An Html parser: {@code parse} takes a string and calls methods on
56 * {@code goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler} while it is visiting it.
57 *
58 * @constructor
59 */
60goog.string.html.HtmlParser = function() {
61};
62
63
64/**
65 * HTML entities that are encoded/decoded.
66 * TODO(user): use {@code goog.string.htmlEncode} instead.
67 * @type {!Object.<string, string>}
68 */
69goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Entities = {
70 'lt': '<',
71 'gt': '>',
72 'amp': '&',
73 'nbsp': '\u00a0',
74 'quot': '"',
75 'apos': '\''
76};

79/**
80 * The html eflags, used internally on the parser.
81 * @enum {number}
82 */
83goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags = {
84 OPTIONAL_ENDTAG: 1,
85 EMPTY: 2,
86 CDATA: 4,
87 RCDATA: 8,
88 UNSAFE: 16,
89 FOLDABLE: 32
90};

211/**
212 * Regular expression that matches &s.
213 * @type {RegExp}
214 * @private
215 */
216goog.string.html.HtmlParser.AMP_RE_ = /&/g;
217
218
219/**
220 * Regular expression that matches loose &s.
221 * @type {RegExp}
222 * @private
223 */
224goog.string.html.HtmlParser.LOOSE_AMP_RE_ =
225 /&([^a-z#]|#(?:[^0-9x]|x(?:[^0-9a-f]|$)|$)|$)/gi;
226
227
228/**
229 * Regular expression that matches <.
230 * @type {RegExp}
231 * @private
232 */
233goog.string.html.HtmlParser.LT_RE_ = /</g;
234
235
236/**
237 * Regular expression that matches >.
238 * @type {RegExp}
239 * @private
240 */
241goog.string.html.HtmlParser.GT_RE_ = />/g;
242
243
244/**
245 * Regular expression that matches ".
246 * @type {RegExp}
247 * @private
248 */
249goog.string.html.HtmlParser.QUOTE_RE_ = /\"/g;
250
251
252/**
253 * Regular expression that matches =.
254 * @type {RegExp}
255 * @private
256 */
257goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EQUALS_RE_ = /=/g;
258
259
260/**
261 * Regular expression that matches null characters.
262 * @type {RegExp}
263 * @private
264 */
265goog.string.html.HtmlParser.NULL_RE_ = /\0/g;
266
267
268/**
269 * Regular expression that matches entities.
270 * @type {RegExp}
271 * @private
272 */
273goog.string.html.HtmlParser.ENTITY_RE_ = /&(#\d+|#x[0-9A-Fa-f]+|\w+);/g;
274
275
276/**
277 * Regular expression that matches decimal numbers.
278 * @type {RegExp}
279 * @private
280 */
281goog.string.html.HtmlParser.DECIMAL_ESCAPE_RE_ = /^#(\d+)$/;
282
283
284/**
285 * Regular expression that matches hexadecimal numbers.
286 * @type {RegExp}
287 * @private
288 */
289goog.string.html.HtmlParser.HEX_ESCAPE_RE_ = /^#x([0-9A-Fa-f]+)$/;
290
291
292/**
293 * Regular expression that matches the next token to be processed.
294 * @type {RegExp}
295 * @private
296 */
297goog.string.html.HtmlParser.INSIDE_TAG_TOKEN_ = new RegExp(
298 // Don't capture space.
299 '^\\s*(?:' +
300 // Capture an attribute name in group 1, and value in group 3.
301 // We capture the fact that there was an attribute in group 2, since
302 // interpreters are inconsistent in whether a group that matches nothing
303 // is null, undefined, or the empty string.
304 ('(?:' +
305 '([a-z][a-z-]*)' + // attribute name
306 ('(' + // optionally followed
307 '\\s*=\\s*' +
308 ('(' +
309 // A double quoted string.
310 '\"[^\"]*\"' +
311 // A single quoted string.
312 '|\'[^\']*\'' +
313 // The positive lookahead is used to make sure that in
314 // <foo bar= baz=boo>, the value for bar is blank, not "baz=boo".
315 '|(?=[a-z][a-z-]*\\s*=)' +
316 // An unquoted value that is not an attribute name.
317 // We know it is not an attribute name because the previous
318 // zero-width match would've eliminated that possibility.
319 '|[^>\"\'\\s]*' +
320 ')'
321 ) +
322 ')'
323 ) + '?' +
324 ')'
325 ) +
326 // End of tag captured in group 3.
327 '|(/?>)' +
328 // Don't capture cruft
329 '|[^a-z\\s>]+)',
330 'i');
331
332
333/**
334 * Regular expression that matches the next token to be processed when we are
335 * outside a tag.
336 * @type {RegExp}
337 * @private
338 */
339goog.string.html.HtmlParser.OUTSIDE_TAG_TOKEN_ = new RegExp(
340 '^(?:' +
341 // Entity captured in group 1.
342 '&(\\#[0-9]+|\\#[x][0-9a-f]+|\\w+);' +
343 // Comment, doctypes, and processing instructions not captured.
344 '|<[!]--[\\s\\S]*?-->|<!\\w[^>]*>|<\\?[^>*]*>' +
345 // '/' captured in group 2 for close tags, and name captured in group 3.
346 '|<(/)?([a-z][a-z0-9]*)' +
347 // Text captured in group 4.
348 '|([^<&>]+)' +
349 // Cruft captured in group 5.
350 '|([<&>]))',
351 'i');
352
353
354/**
355 * Given a SAX-like {@code goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler} parses a
356 * {@code htmlText} and lets the {@code handler} know the structure while
357 * visiting the nodes.
358 *
359 * @param {goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler} handler The HtmlSaxHandler that will
360 * receive the events.
361 * @param {string} htmlText The html text.
362 */
363goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.parse = function(handler, htmlText) {
364 var htmlLower = null;
365 var inTag = false; // True iff we're currently processing a tag.
366 var attribs = []; // Accumulates attribute names and values.
367 var tagName; // The name of the tag currently being processed.
368 var eflags; // The element flags for the current tag.
369 var openTag; // True if the current tag is an open tag.
370
371 // Lets the handler know that we are starting to parse the document.
372 handler.startDoc();
373
374 // Consumes tokens from the htmlText and stops once all tokens are processed.
375 while (htmlText) {
376 var regex = inTag ?
377 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.INSIDE_TAG_TOKEN_ :
378 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.OUTSIDE_TAG_TOKEN_;
379 // Gets the next token
380 var m = htmlText.match(regex);
381 // And removes it from the string
382 htmlText = htmlText.substring(m[0].length);
383
384 // TODO(goto): cleanup this code breaking it into separate methods.
385 if (inTag) {
386 if (m[1]) { // Attribute.
387 // SetAttribute with uppercase names doesn't work on IE6.
388 var attribName = goog.string.html.toLowerCase(m[1]);
389 var decodedValue;
390 if (m[2]) {
391 var encodedValue = m[3];
392 switch (encodedValue.charCodeAt(0)) { // Strip quotes.
393 case 34: case 39:
394 encodedValue = encodedValue.substring(
395 1, encodedValue.length - 1);
396 break;
397 }
398 decodedValue = this.unescapeEntities_(this.stripNULs_(encodedValue));
399 } else {
400 // Use name as value for valueless attribs, so
401 // <input type=checkbox checked>
402 // gets attributes ['type', 'checkbox', 'checked', 'checked']
403 decodedValue = attribName;
404 }
405 attribs.push(attribName, decodedValue);
406 } else if (m[4]) {
407 if (eflags !== void 0) { // False if not in whitelist.
408 if (openTag) {
409 if (handler.startTag) {
410 handler.startTag(/** @type {string} */ (tagName), attribs);
411 }
412 } else {
413 if (handler.endTag) {
414 handler.endTag(/** @type {string} */ (tagName));
415 }
416 }
417 }
418
419 if (openTag && (eflags &
420 (goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags.CDATA |
421 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags.RCDATA))) {
422 if (htmlLower === null) {
423 htmlLower = goog.string.html.toLowerCase(htmlText);
424 } else {
425 htmlLower = htmlLower.substring(
426 htmlLower.length - htmlText.length);
427 }
428 var dataEnd = htmlLower.indexOf('</' + tagName);
429 if (dataEnd < 0) {
430 dataEnd = htmlText.length;
431 }
432 if (eflags & goog.string.html.HtmlParser.EFlags.CDATA) {
433 if (handler.cdata) {
434 handler.cdata(htmlText.substring(0, dataEnd));
435 }
436 } else if (handler.rcdata) {
437 handler.rcdata(
438 this.normalizeRCData_(htmlText.substring(0, dataEnd)));
439 }
440 htmlText = htmlText.substring(dataEnd);
441 }
442
443 tagName = eflags = openTag = void 0;
444 attribs.length = 0;
445 inTag = false;
446 }
447 } else {
448 if (m[1]) { // Entity.
449 handler.pcdata(m[0]);
450 } else if (m[3]) { // Tag.
451 openTag = !m[2];
452 inTag = true;
453 tagName = goog.string.html.toLowerCase(m[3]);
454 eflags = goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Elements.hasOwnProperty(tagName) ?
455 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Elements[tagName] : void 0;
456 } else if (m[4]) { // Text.
457 handler.pcdata(m[4]);
458 } else if (m[5]) { // Cruft.
459 switch (m[5]) {
460 case '<': handler.pcdata('&lt;'); break;
461 case '>': handler.pcdata('&gt;'); break;
462 default: handler.pcdata('&amp;'); break;
463 }
464 }
465 }
466 }
467
468 // Lets the handler know that we are done parsing the document.
469 handler.endDoc();
470};
471
472
473/**
474 * Decodes an HTML entity.
475 *
476 * @param {string} name The content between the '&' and the ';'.
477 * @return {string} A single unicode code-point as a string.
478 * @private
479 */
480goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.lookupEntity_ = function(name) {
481 // TODO(goto): use {goog.string.htmlDecode} instead ?
482 // TODO(goto): &pi; is different from &Pi;
483 name = goog.string.html.toLowerCase(name);
484 if (goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Entities.hasOwnProperty(name)) {
485 return goog.string.html.HtmlParser.Entities[name];
486 }
487 var m = name.match(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.DECIMAL_ESCAPE_RE_);
488 if (m) {
489 return String.fromCharCode(parseInt(m[1], 10));
490 } else if (
491 !!(m = name.match(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.HEX_ESCAPE_RE_))) {
492 return String.fromCharCode(parseInt(m[1], 16));
493 }
494 return '';
495};
496
497
498/**
499 * Removes null characters on the string.
500 * @param {string} s The string to have the null characters removed.
501 * @return {string} A string without null characters.
502 * @private
503 */
504goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.stripNULs_ = function(s) {
505 return s.replace(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.NULL_RE_, '');
506};
507
508
509/**
510 * The plain text of a chunk of HTML CDATA which possibly containing.
511 *
512 * TODO(goto): use {@code goog.string.unescapeEntities} instead ?
513 * @param {string} s A chunk of HTML CDATA. It must not start or end inside
514 * an HTML entity.
515 * @return {string} The unescaped entities.
516 * @private
517 */
518goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.unescapeEntities_ = function(s) {
519 return s.replace(
520 goog.string.html.HtmlParser.ENTITY_RE_,
521 goog.bind(this.lookupEntity_, this));
522};
523
524
525/**
526 * Escape entities in RCDATA that can be escaped without changing the meaning.
527 * @param {string} rcdata The RCDATA string we want to normalize.
528 * @return {string} A normalized version of RCDATA.
529 * @private
530 */
531goog.string.html.HtmlParser.prototype.normalizeRCData_ = function(rcdata) {
532 return rcdata.
533 replace(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.LOOSE_AMP_RE_, '&amp;$1').
534 replace(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.LT_RE_, '&lt;').
535 replace(goog.string.html.HtmlParser.GT_RE_, '&gt;');
536};
537
538
539/**
540 * TODO(goto): why isn't this in the string package ? does this solves any
541 * real problem ? move it to the goog.string package if it does.
542 *
543 * @param {string} str The string to lower case.
544 * @return {string} The str in lower case format.
545 */
546goog.string.html.toLowerCase = function(str) {
547 // The below may not be true on browsers in the Turkish locale.
548 if ('script' === 'SCRIPT'.toLowerCase()) {
549 return str.toLowerCase();
550 } else {
551 return str.replace(/[A-Z]/g, function(ch) {
552 return String.fromCharCode(ch.charCodeAt(0) | 32);
553 });
554 }
555};
556
557
558
559/**
560 * An interface to the {@code goog.string.html.HtmlParser} visitor, that gets
561 * called while the HTML is being parsed.
562 *
563 * @interface
564 */
565goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler = function() {
566};
567
568
569/**
570 * Handler called when the parser found a new tag.
571 * @param {string} name The name of the tag that is starting.
572 * @param {Array.<string>} attributes The attributes of the tag.
573 */
574goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.startTag = goog.abstractMethod;
575
576
577/**
578 * Handler called when the parser found a closing tag.
579 * @param {string} name The name of the tag that is ending.
580 */
581goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.endTag = goog.abstractMethod;
582
583
584/**
585 * Handler called when PCDATA is found.
586 * @param {string} text The PCDATA text found.
587 */
588goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.pcdata = goog.abstractMethod;
589
590
591/**
592 * Handler called when RCDATA is found.
593 * @param {string} text The RCDATA text found.
594 */
595goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.rcdata = goog.abstractMethod;
596
597
598/**
599 * Handler called when CDATA is found.
600 * @param {string} text The CDATA text found.
601 */
602goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.cdata = goog.abstractMethod;
603
604
605/**
606 * Handler called when the parser is starting to parse the document.
607 */
608goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.startDoc = goog.abstractMethod;
609
610
611/**
612 * Handler called when the parsing is done.
613 */
614goog.string.html.HtmlSaxHandler.prototype.endDoc = goog.abstractMethod;
